intro: Myrceugenia bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the temperate regions of southern South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which is typically dense and leathery. It produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Myrceugenia bracteosa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
